                    </button>
                </div>

    <div class="summary">
        <h3><a href="/questions/223325/could-there-be-biomes-inside-of-asteroids" class="question-hyperlink">Could there be biomes inside of asteroids?</a></h3>
        <div class="excerpt">
            I don't mean &quot;biome&quot; in the strict scientific definition, but rather, in the broader geological sense that it is used by game designers to refer to unique environments. On earth, when people ...
        </div>
        <div class="d-flex ai-start fw-wrap">
            <div class="flex--item">
                <div class="d-flex gs4 fw-wrap tags t-geology t-astrophysics">
    <a href="/questions/tagged/geology" class="post-tag flex--item" title="show questions tagged &#39;geology&#39;" rel="tag">geology</a> <a href="/questions/tagged/astrophysics" class="post-tag flex--item" title="show questions tagged &#39;astrophysics&#39;" rel="tag">astrophysics</a>               </div>
            </div>
            <div class="flex--item ml-auto fl-shrink0 started mt0">

                StackExchange.ga.init({

    <div class="summary">
        <h3><a href="/questions/223120/is-there-any-reason-that-justify-or-make-seem-more-optimal-to-make-sky-observati" class="question-hyperlink">Is there any reason that justify or make seem more optimal to make sky observations for astronomical purposes on equinox and solstice?</a></h3>
        <div class="excerpt">
            In the setting I'm working on a giant mechanism opens on every equinox and solstice to record the sky and use the data for calculations that are required for the story plot.
For astronomical reasons, ...
        </div>
        <div class="d-flex ai-start fw-wrap">
            <div class="flex--item">
                <div class="d-flex gs4 fw-wrap tags t-technology t-astronomy">

    <div class="summary">
        <h3><a href="/questions/223068/ways-to-neutralize-firearms" class="question-hyperlink">Ways to Neutralize Firearms [closed]</a></h3>
        <div class="excerpt">
            I am trying to write a sci-fi story in the near future where armies use mechas but I also want them to engage in close combat using swords.
Here is what I came up with so far:

    <div class="summary">
        <h3><a href="/questions/223039/how-to-make-terrestrial-biochemistry-more-acid-resistant" class="question-hyperlink">How to make terrestrial biochemistry more acid-resistant?</a></h3>

    <div class="summary">
        <h3><a href="/questions/222938/could-medieval-ships-be-designed-for-a-nearly-boiling-sea" class="question-hyperlink">Could medieval ships be designed for a nearly boiling sea?</a></h3>
        <div class="excerpt">
            In my setting, there is a massive crater that results from a divine apocalyptic event. Long story short, due to the sheer power contained within it, the water within the sea created by the crater is ...

            <div class="flex--item">

        <h3><a href="/questions/222795/how-to-recreate-units-of-measure" class="question-hyperlink">How to recreate units of measure?</a></h3>

    var clc = clc || {};
    clc.collapse = { sb: !0, 'tag-sponsorship': !0, lb: !0, mlb: !0, smlb: !0, bmlb: !0, 'mobile-below-question': !0 };

    clc.options.hb = !1;

    clc.options.targeting_consent = !1;
    clc.options.performance_consent = !1;

        clc.dfp.targeting = {Registered:['false']};
        clc.dfp.targeting.TargetingConsent = ['false'];

        const urlParams = new URLSearchParams(window.location.search);
        if (urlParams.has('dfptestads')) {
            const dfptestads = urlParams.get('dfptestads');
            clc.dfp.targeting.DfpTestAds = dfptestads;
        }
        
        var googletag = googletag || {};
        googletag.cmd = googletag.cmd || [];
        googletag.cmd.push(function () { clc.dfp.load(); });
</script>

<div class="question-summary" id="question-summary-222757">
    <div class="statscontainer">
        <div class="stats">
            <div class="vote">
                <div class="votes">
                    <span class="vote-count-post "><strong>8</strong></span>
                    <div class="viewcount">votes</div>
                </div>
            </div>
            <div class="status answered">
                <strong>8</strong>answers
            </div>
        </div>
        <div class=" views" title="337 views">337 views</div>
    </div>
    <div class="summary">
        <h3><a href="/questions/222757/what-melee-weapons-to-use-for-small-fireteams-fighting-many-small-enemies" class="question-hyperlink">What melee weapons to use for small fireteams fighting many small enemies?</a></h3>
        <div class="excerpt">
            The fluff:
As part of the world I'm building there is modern technology of firearms. However there is a problem: there are some categories of creatures (from some of my previous questions) that just ...
        </div>
        <div class="d-flex ai-start fw-wrap">

    <div class="summary">
        <h3><a href="/questions/222002/what-would-be-some-social-welfare-systems-of-a-first-world-developed-nation-with" class="question-hyperlink">What would be some social welfare systems of a first world developed nation with a GINI Index of 32.56? [closed]</a></h3>
        <div class="excerpt">
            GINI is a term that is used to measure income inequality (See here for examples https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_countries_by_income_equality) and is a good indication on to what kind of society ...
        </div>
        <div class="d-flex ai-start fw-wrap">

        <div id="hot-network-questions" class="module tex2jax_ignore">
    <h4>
        <a href="https://stackexchange.com/questions?tab=hot"
           class="js-gps-track s-link s-link__inherit" 
           data-gps-track="posts_hot_network.click({ item_type:1, location:9 })">
            Hot Network Questions
        </a>
    </h4>
    <ul>
            <li >
                <div class="favicon favicon-mathematica" title="Mathematica Stack Exchange"></div><a href="https://mathematica.stackexchange.com/questions/263048/iterate-over-without-needing-to-define-a-variable" class="js-gps-track question-hyperlink mb0" data-gps-track="site.switch({ item_type:9, target_site:387 }); posts_hot_network.click({ item_type:2, location:9 })">
                    Iterate over # without needing to define a variable
                </a>

<div class="question-summary" id="question-summary-221628">
    <div class="statscontainer">
        <div class="stats">
            <div class="vote">
                <div class="votes">
                    <span class="vote-count-post "><strong>4</strong></span>
                    <div class="viewcount">votes</div>
                </div>
            </div>
            <div class="status answered">
                <strong>1</strong>answer
            </div>
        </div>
        <div class=" views" title="64 views">64 views</div>
    </div>
    <div class="summary">
        <h3><a href="/questions/221628/can-this-headgear-be-used-for-defense-even-if-woven-and-curved-sideways" class="question-hyperlink">Can this &quot;headgear&quot; be used for defense even if woven and curved sideways?</a></h3>
        <div class="excerpt">
            I really like this concept for headgear and I was wondering about their use. Since I plan on designing a creature with similar headgear.

My theory is that due to the way they are bent they don't have ...
        </div>
        <div class="d-flex ai-start fw-wrap">
            <div class="flex--item">
                <div class="d-flex gs4 fw-wrap tags t-biology t-creature-design t-anatomy t-self-defense t-fight">

    clc.collapse = { sb: !0, 'tag-sponsorship': !0, lb: !0, mlb: !0, smlb: !0, bmlb: !0, 'mobile-below-question': !0 };
    clc.options = clc.options || {};

    clc.options.hb = !1;
    clc.options.ll = !0;
    clc.options.targeting_consent = !1;
    clc.options.performance_consent = !1;
        clc.dfp = clc.dfp || {};
        clc.dfp.targeting = {Registered:['false']};
        clc.dfp.targeting.TargetingConsent = ['false'];

        const urlParams = new URLSearchParams(window.location.search);
        if (urlParams.has('dfptestads')) {
            const dfptestads = urlParams.get('dfptestads');
            clc.dfp.targeting.DfpTestAds = dfptestads;
        }

        googletag.cmd = googletag.cmd || [];
        googletag.cmd.push(function () { clc.dfp.load(); });

</header>
